text: Having gained a foothold in the Albaneve Summits, we had a few tasks to take care of. Welcome to Enshrouded First on the list was to raise the flame level of our world.  The flame is one of the content gating mechanics of Enshrouded.  Raising the level of the flame in the world both gives you access to more areas in the shroud… the red shroud kills you fast and is there to remind you to work on that flame level… as well as granting additional benefits. In our case, Potshot had put down a shrine and built us a nice little base up above the frost line, but even inside with a fire going, the frost timer was still running with a message telling us to upgrade the flame. Upgrade the flame it says! We were at flame level 6 so we immediately set our eyes on raising that to level 7 so as to be toasty inside out own base… and to be able to move into some of the red shroud we were bumping up against.  That meant, as I mentioned last time, finding a Fell Cyclops head. The Fell Cyclops was rumored to be down in the Elixir Well in the valley below out little base… down in the shroud… down where we could almost see.   The shroud is always a bit foggy.  But exploring that Elixir Well was on our list of tasks in any case, so we were going there. It is down there somewhere We could have taken the safe approach and walked down there, following the road or path… roads or paths almost always seem to lead somewhere interesting in Enshrouded… but through the mists of the shroud we could kind of see a bridge and maybe a cave that marked the spot.  So we decided to jump and glide… because we have gliders, so why wouldn’t we? Also, we had a frost timer running and were not keen to find out what happens when the timer reaches zero.  Gliding helped us speed things up.  And, in the end, we landed in about the right place… where the flame shrine was outside of the entrance.  A flame shrine is a sure sign of trouble ahead. Down and at the flame shrine in the snow Now we had two timers running, the frost timer and the shroud timer.  The shroud timer was shorter, but also more easily reset.  Potshot said that his research showed that there should be three shroud roots within the Elixir Well area… good for us, for more skill points… so we headed into the well. There were some mobs in there to fight, but once we cleared them out, we were left looking for a way forward.  The only hint, as happens in Enshrouded, was a platform that pointed out into an open… or open-ish… area, which brought with it the implication that were going to have to jump off and glide into the unknown, hoping there would be a place to land. The clock was ticking, so I jumped off, glided through an opening, hit a thermal that lifted me up some, and spotted another platform with a grappling hook spot on it.  I wasn’t positioned very well to land, but I grabbed the grapple as it became available and landed on the platform. On the landing platform, looking back the way I came Then I had to describe to Potshot and Ula where I went, which I am not always great at.  But they could just barely see me if I jumped up and down holding a torch.  So they made the leap, glided and landed… because, behind me stood the first shroud root. Time to chop this down We took care of that… I had cleared the area on my landing, the locals being rather eager to engage me… and went looking for our next shroud root, which turned out to be visible from where we were… once we found the next platform to jump from. There is the next shroud root That was another jump and glide, with the need to hit the updraft… you can see the white column of it over my right shoulder… which I managed to get right, landing safely.  We all got over there then, during the fight, I went to do a jump attack, hit the space bar once too many times, and went into glider mode and sailed off the edge of the platform, ending up in the red danger at below that sapped my shroud timer and lift almost instantly. Consumed… dead again That put me out at the flame shrine where we started.  I had to thread my way back, doing both glides again, which I managed successfully.  Once back the second shroud root was chopped and another skill point was earned. That left us with one more to go.  There was a path up and around with some jumping and grapples, but we soon found that final shroud root, along with its guardian, the Fell Cyclops.  The battle was on. Starting by hitting him at range with my bow… no, not the flare arrow! Once he got close enough I used my boss grapple to pull myself onto him and commenced whaling on him as hard as I could.  A number of the bosses are ineffective with their big attacks if you are in too close, and that seemed to be the case here… right up until he did a big stomp that threw me straight up in the air.  I was in so close it was hard for me to see what was going on until I realized I was falling back to the ground again.  It was too late to deploy my glider and the fall killed me… again. Ula faced him and beat on him some more, but she too fell, leaving Potshot to take him on.  However, we had taken a big enough bite out of the Fell Cyclops by then that he was able to use his bow to cut the boss down.  Then it was time to be revived, which left us with that third shroud root to chop. Just the shroud root left We took care of that, then poked around a bit before deciding it might be best to fast travel back to base to upgrade the flame. Fell Cyclops head in hand, we upgraded to level 7. Flame Level 7 Achieved That also gave us a new task, a new challenge for the Albaneve Summits. The next task revealed It was back to Albaneve Summits, where we found… we were still getting the frost timer inside of our base.  It turns out we needed to upgrade the flame one more time to get frost protection indoors.  And the level eight flame upgrade needed a new bosses head to complete. The level 8 flame list The Fell Dragon Youngling was next on our list, but it looked like we would have some work to do in order to find it.  That seemed likely to be the corrupted being referred to in the new flame quest, and that required us to go find and light the eight balefires. I had found and lit one the week before when I was out exploring, but there were seven more to find.  We set out, heading for a castle area near our base. Entering Everfrore Keep Before we did the level seven flame upgrade much of the keep area was covered in deadly red shroud.  That was gone, replaced by normal shroud that we could travel through.  We explored that, then passed on out the back side of it and deeper into the Albaneve Summits… totally missing the balefire we should have lit.  We’ll have to go back, though it is fairly close to the base Potshot built. We went exploring, finding at least one of the balefires along the way. Just light this and done We made our way around, in an attempt to approach yet another possible balefire site and ended up in the town of Polaris Falls, which was nicely nestled deep in the zone and was below the frost line.  So we put down a flame shrine there to make it a fast travel point from which we could explore. Looking around Polaris Falls At the time of this writing, we have picked up four of the eight balefires… though embarrassingly I have been to at least two others and somehow missed lighting them.  Such an explorer.  So we should be able to wrap up a couple more fairly easily.  Then we have to find the rest, though they are visible due to a red beam reaching up into the sky from them. That looks like one down there The trick is, of course, getting to them.  While the upgrade to flame level seven pushed back the deadly red shroud, it did not banish it from the zone.  You can see red shroud in the valley below around that particular tower.  Seem like that might be another job for the glider.
html:
Having gained a foothold in the Albaneve Summits, we had a few tasks to take care of.

Welcome to Enshrouded

First on the list was to raise the flame level of our world.  The flame is one of the content gating mechanics of Enshrouded.  Raising the level of the flame in the world both gives you access to more areas in the shroud… the red shroud kills you fast and is there to remind you to work on that flame level… as well as granting additional benefits.

In our case, Potshot had put down a shrine and built us a nice little base up above the frost line, but even inside with a fire going, the frost timer was still running with a message telling us to upgrade the flame.

Upgrade the flame it says!

We were at flame level 6 so we immediately set our eyes on raising that to level 7 so as to be toasty inside out own base… and to be able to move into some of the red shroud we were bumping up against.  That meant, as I mentioned last time, finding a Fell Cyclops head.

The Fell Cyclops was rumored to be down in the Elixir Well in the valley below out little base… down in the shroud… down where we could almost see.   The shroud is always a bit foggy.  But exploring that Elixir Well was on our list of tasks in any case, so we were going there.

It is down there somewhere

We could have taken the safe approach and walked down there, following the road or path… roads or paths almost always seem to lead somewhere interesting in Enshrouded… but through the mists of the shroud we could kind of see a bridge and maybe a cave that marked the spot.  So we decided to jump and glide… because we have gliders, so why wouldn’t we?

Also, we had a frost timer running and were not keen to find out what happens when the timer reaches zero.  Gliding helped us speed things up.  And, in the end, we landed in about the right place… where the flame shrine was outside of the entrance.  A flame shrine is a sure sign of trouble ahead.

Down and at the flame shrine in the snow

Now we had two timers running, the frost timer and the shroud timer.  The shroud timer was shorter, but also more easily reset.  Potshot said that his research showed that there should be three shroud roots within the Elixir Well area… good for us, for more skill points… so we headed into the well.

There were some mobs in there to fight, but once we cleared them out, we were left looking for a way forward.  The only hint, as happens in Enshrouded, was a platform that pointed out into an open… or open-ish… area, which brought with it the implication that were going to have to jump off and glide into the unknown, hoping there would be a place to land.

The clock was ticking, so I jumped off, glided through an opening, hit a thermal that lifted me up some, and spotted another platform with a grappling hook spot on it.  I wasn’t positioned very well to land, but I grabbed the grapple as it became available and landed on the platform.

On the landing platform, looking back the way I came

Then I had to describe to Potshot and Ula where I went, which I am not always great at.  But they could just barely see me if I jumped up and down holding a torch.  So they made the leap, glided and landed… because, behind me stood the first shroud root.

Time to chop this down

We took care of that… I had cleared the area on my landing, the locals being rather eager to engage me… and went looking for our next shroud root, which turned out to be visible from where we were… once we found the next platform to jump from.

There is the next shroud root

That was another jump and glide, with the need to hit the updraft… you can see the white column of it over my right shoulder… which I managed to get right, landing safely.  We all got over there then, during the fight, I went to do a jump attack, hit the space bar once too many times, and went into glider mode and sailed off the edge of the platform, ending up in the red danger at below that sapped my shroud timer and lift almost instantly.

Consumed… dead again

That put me out at the flame shrine where we started.  I had to thread my way back, doing both glides again, which I managed successfully.  Once back the second shroud root was chopped and another skill point was earned.

That left us with one more to go.  There was a path up and around with some jumping and grapples, but we soon found that final shroud root, along with its guardian, the Fell Cyclops.  The battle was on.

Starting by hitting him at range with my bow… no, not the flare arrow!

Once he got close enough I used my boss grapple to pull myself onto him and commenced whaling on him as hard as I could.  A number of the bosses are ineffective with their big attacks if you are in too close, and that seemed to be the case here… right up until he did a big stomp that threw me straight up in the air.  I was in so close it was hard for me to see what was going on until I realized I was falling back to the ground again.  It was too late to deploy my glider and the fall killed me… again.

Ula faced him and beat on him some more, but she too fell, leaving Potshot to take him on.  However, we had taken a big enough bite out of the Fell Cyclops by then that he was able to use his bow to cut the boss down.  Then it was time to be revived, which left us with that third shroud root to chop.

Just the shroud root left

We took care of that, then poked around a bit before deciding it might be best to fast travel back to base to upgrade the flame.

Fell Cyclops head in hand, we upgraded to level 7.

Flame Level 7 Achieved

That also gave us a new task, a new challenge for the Albaneve Summits.

The next task revealed

It was back to Albaneve Summits, where we found… we were still getting the frost timer inside of our base.  It turns out we needed to upgrade the flame one more time to get frost protection indoors.  And the level eight flame upgrade needed a new bosses head to complete.

The level 8 flame list

The Fell Dragon Youngling was next on our list, but it looked like we would have some work to do in order to find it.  That seemed likely to be the corrupted being referred to in the new flame quest, and that required us to go find and light the eight balefires.

I had found and lit one the week before when I was out exploring, but there were seven more to find.  We set out, heading for a castle area near our base.

Entering Everfrore Keep

Before we did the level seven flame upgrade much of the keep area was covered in deadly red shroud.  That was gone, replaced by normal shroud that we could travel through.  We explored that, then passed on out the back side of it and deeper into the Albaneve Summits… totally missing the balefire we should have lit.  We’ll have to go back, though it is fairly close to the base Potshot built.

We went exploring, finding at least one of the balefires along the way.

Just light this and done

We made our way around, in an attempt to approach yet another possible balefire site and ended up in the town of Polaris Falls, which was nicely nestled deep in the zone and was below the frost line.  So we put down a flame shrine there to make it a fast travel point from which we could explore.

Looking around Polaris Falls

At the time of this writing, we have picked up four of the eight balefires… though embarrassingly I have been to at least two others and somehow missed lighting them.  Such an explorer.  So we should be able to wrap up a couple more fairly easily.  Then we have to find the rest, though they are visible due to a red beam reaching up into the sky from them.

That looks like one down there

The trick is, of course, getting to them.  While the upgrade to flame level seven pushed back the deadly red shroud, it did not banish it from the zone.  You can see red shroud in the valley below around that particular tower.  Seem like that might be another job for the glider.
